results.title: [Melbourne District Nursing Service Centre Openings]
results.brief_description:
The Royal District Nursing Service was founded in 1885 and was originally called the Melbourne District Nursing Service. An initiative led by the Reverend Charles Strong, the organisation was established to nurse the sick, poor and disadvantaged in their own homes. By the early 1920s the nurses were treating 25,000 patients per year and had established a convalescent institution, the After-Care Home (later Hospital) in Collingwood. In 1966 the organisation became the Royal District Nursing Service.

This film captures the opening of two Melbourne District Nursing Service centres in Melbourne in 1964 and 1965 and an event celebrating the renaming of the organisation to the Royal District Nursing Service in 1966. The film features great footage of 1960s nursing equipment, uniforms, fashions of the period, architecture and interiors of the centres and procedures for nursing visits.

The first ceremony takes place on 28th February 1964 and features an opening speech by Lady Delacombe, the wife of Sir Rohan Delacombe, Governor of Victoria. The camera focuses on several photographs on the walls of the centre - including the first two nurses of the MDNS, Nurse Ferguson and Nurse Cannon; nurses in Victorian era uniform on bicycles; and nurses in the 1920s wearing pith helmets with red Maltese cross.

The opening of the Footscray Centre takes place on 5th April 1965 and the proceedings are opened by the Minister for Health, R. W. Mack. The final section of film shows an event celebrating renaming the organisation the Royal District Nursing Service, in 1966.

results.title: [Orwell Michaelis Home Movies: Reel 1]
results.brief_description:
This collection of home movies, originally filmed on 8mm and 16mm film, was taken between 1938 and 1956 by Orwell Michaelis. The collection was donated to ACMI by Michaelis’s daughter, Sally Cohen, and her husband Sheldon Cohen. The films show life in Melbourne including the 1956 Olympic Games, a fishing trip to Bermagui in NSW, and holidays in Indonesia.

This is a home movie from the Michaelis family of early Melbourne. ‘Australian Scenes’ is the title on screen and starts with a lovely view from the Yarra looking back to the city skyline. The river bank is packed as an exciting rowing regatta takes place. A great shot facing south from the top of Swanston Street and then the Shrine of Remembrance. We see a passing parade of Australian Army personnel in their slouch hats. A crowd on the steps of the Old Treasury Building. ‘Flemington, Cup Day, 1940’ is next with crowds of men in hats and wide shots of the running of the race and winners circle. A tennis match is played in front of a sold-out crowd in the ‘1946 Davis Cup Challenge’ at Kooyong’s tennis courts. A very scenic ‘Picnic at Warrandyte’ reflects a relaxing day out with the family in the country. There is footage of Australian native animals at what is possibly Healesville Sanctuary. ‘Bayside Scenes’ shows families enjoying the cooling waters of Port Phillip Bay. ‘Autumn at Macedon’ is a brief scene of trees in autumn colours. We then see the 1956 Olympic Games opening in Melbourne and the parade of athletes, releasing doves and the lighting of the flame. The film shows some events shot from the stands.

Selected Highlights List (time codes from Access Overscan)

00:35:00:00 rowing regatta on the Yarra
00:52:00:00 Melbourne street scene with vintage cars and tram #64. Facing south from the top end of Swanston Street.
00:59:00:00 St Kilda Road with Shrine of Remembrance in the distance; tram tracks and vintage cars
00:01:15:00 Shrine of Remembrance with people assembled on stairs
00:01:23:00 Melbourne Street scene, pedestrians and cars
00:01:28:00 possibly an Anzac Day march led by an army band and followed by soldiers
00:01:54:00 spectators crowd on the steps on the Old Treasury Building
00:02:06:00 Melbourne Cup Day, Flemington 1940. Punters crowd around the bookmakers – one being M. Labb
00:02:19:00 race horses being led around the mounting yard
00:02:47:00 footage of race (possibly the Melbourne Cup) shot from the grand stand
00:03:00:00 officials and jockey Andy Knox assemble for the cup presentation
00:03:07:00 1946 Davis Cup Challenge footage of Kooyong Centre Court and crowds in the grandstand
00:03:41:00 men’s singles match footage
00:03:51:00 men’s doubles match footage
00:04:29:00 close-up of the Davis Cup trophy with onlookers inspecting it
00:04:43:00 river in Warrandyte with swimmers on the bank
00:05:06:00 an old-style fireplace bush BBQ with chops and a billy boiling on the grill
00:05:10:00 close-up of a delicious looking BBQ’d lamb chop
00:05:13:00 family bush picnic in bucolic surrounds, eating picnic fare and sitting on blankets
00:05:23:00 rural scene with lake or dam and cabins with smoking chimneys and vintage cars parked around the cabins
00:08:46:00 Melbourne Olympic Games 1956 Opening Ceremony booklet or program
00:08:51:00 exterior of Melbourne Olympic stadium
00:09:09:00 interior of the Olympic stadium
00:09:40:00 atheletes enter the main stadium for the opening march and parade around the track
00:10:41:00 doves are released in to the stadium
00:10:48:00 Ron Clarke enters the stadium carrying the Olympic torch
00:10:58:00 shot of the Olympic cauldron alight with country flags in the background
00:11:26:00 track and field winners on podium

results.title: Maidenhead
results.brief_description: Maidenhead is a series of chamber-fictions inhabited by a young woman named Alice. Linked in an oblique, dream like way, these short, sharp stories describe Alice’s survival in an everyday world of bizarre logic and strange emotions. It’s a place where miracles unfold in the bathroom and desire appears on a bus; where menacing joggers roam the suburbs and there’s something sinister about hats. Vibrant like musical, Maidenhead is at once funny and disquieting, poignant and absurd.

results.title: [Shetland mills]
results.brief_description: Rare print (not titles/credits) of Shetland Mills woollen factory in Melbourne in the early 1950s. Title and print have been withdrawn and print should only be viewed on a Steenbeck. (HG 20/01/06) Looks at a modern knitting mill in Melbourne circa 1950. Shows headquaters near the corner of Lonsdale and Bourke streets; workers arriving for work; delivering the yarn; lunch in the cafeteria; and workers operating equipment.

results.title: [Kodak Cinegraph compilation. No. 06]
results.brief_description: A compilation of silent newsreels including: 1. Wonderful Lake Taupo and trout fishing. 2. North Island - Rotorua, geyserland, a volcano and skiing. Boating on the Wanganui River. 3. Perth, WA - Re-enactment of Fremantle and Stirling proclaiming Western Australian colony in 1829. Winter surfing at Cottesloe and country scenes. 4. The Empire Games in Sydney 1938 - track and field, swimming and diving, and rowing on the Nepean River.

results.title: The Battle against cancer
results.creator_credit: American Cancer Society and Swiss Society for Combating Cancer
results.brief_description: Prepared for lay audiences this film states that in any typical large group of Americans, one in every eight will die of cancer. To combat the high mortality caused by cancer, early treatment by X-ray, radium or surgery is essential. Microscope-slides are used in this film to show normal cell division and growth, and then the invasion of cancer cells breeding wildly.

results.title: RAAF Newsreel. No. 9. Operation sabre ferry
results.creator_credit: Harry Rayner and Australia. Royal Australian Air Force
results.brief_description: Newsreel items including: 1. No. 3 Squadron and No. 77 Squadron of the RAAF ferry the Sabre Jet from the east coast of Australia to Butterworth in Malaya via Townsville, Darwin, Netherlands New Guinea, Philippines, Borneo, Malaya. 2. Firefighter - RAAF demonstrates capability of new firefighting truck. 3. Addition of the new Air to Air Missile to the Sabre Jet Fighter. Test fired at Woomera.

results.title: Women breakout
results.creator_credit: Erika Addis and Halfway House Collective
results.brief_description: This film was made by the Halfway House Collective in Melbourne and is set in Halfway House a feminist refuge. The film does not so much focus on the circumstances that led them to the Halfway House, rather it shows the house giving them support to take control of and change their lives.

results.title: Ship No. 76
results.brief_description: Shows all stages of the construction of the 18,600 ton oil tanker, B.P. Endeavour, at the Newcastle State Dockyard. The Endeavour was the largest ship built in Australia up to 1967.

description_for_label: Shows all stages of the construction of the 18,600 ton oil tanker, B.P. Endeavour, at the Newcastle State Dockyard. The Endeavour was the largest ship built in Australia up to 1967.
